This is how it worked for me:

1. install
2. take the exe and the two .dll from the skidrow folder and put them in your game folder
3. take all files from the orbit folder and put them in both the 'ubisoft\from dust' folder and in the 'ubisot\ubisoft game launcher' folder

If you get the message "fatal error can't create sound device"

1. disable all sound devices that you don't use
2. reboot
3. start the game

If you got BLANK ERROR:
Crack only Ubisoft Luncher, with offline fix.
DO NOT USE GAME CRACK

After trying the SkidRow (and the Offline fix) and the Kaos releases, FD still didn't work.
Running From_Dust.exe just got a small blank dialog.
I found a way to generate the UbisoftGameLauncher command line parameters, and using the Orbit folder was able to get into the Launcher, use any code, but when clicked Play, FD crashed.
Look in the launcher Logs, use a Base64 converter for the path and put it together in a BAT.
I found FD looking for the UGL in D:\, regardless of the registry saying otherwise.
The solution... I put the FD folder onto a blank USB drive and the 'contents' of the Orbit folder into the root of the same drive.
Sorry, I cannot remember where I got the UGL.exe that accepts any code, but it wasnt from KaOs or the SkidRow cracks. I tried many combos, so am not sure what came from where.
From_Dust.exe then worked, started the Launcher, which accepted any code, and Play ran the game.
Oh... another thing, I also use a Mimo 7" USB LCD, managed by DisplayFusion.
The game wont run with the second 'monitor' on. Dungeons (Kalypso Media) has the same problem.
Hope this helps all those not able to play. Good luck.

I'm running windows Vista 64 bit, and once I installed the game, I went straight to the game install folder (C:\program files x86\ubisoft\from dust) and ran fromdust.exe.  This updates the game.  Once it was updated, I closed all windows, and took the Fromdust.exe out of the Skidrow folder and replaced the one the game installed.  I also replaced the Ubisoftgamelauncher.exe in the gamelauncher folder.  Those were the only two files I replaced and after uninstalling/reinstalling 4 different times (trying 4 different install methods) this method worked for me.

I'm on Windows 7 64-bit, and here's what worked for me:

1) Download this torrent.
2) Install the game by mounting the .iso and using the install wizard.
3) Once installed, go to the install directory you chose during installation, or C:\Program Files(x86)\Ubisoft\From Dust\ by default, and run From_Dust.exe. This updates the game.
4) Once it's done updating, a box will come up asking for a username and password.  Close this window.
5) Open the .iso using WinRAR or some other program to open it as a folder, rather than running it like a disc.
6) Open the SKIDROW folder.
7) Take the From_Dust.exe from the SKIDROW folder and copy it to your install directory, replacing the one you just used in step 3.
8) In the orbit folder (which is inside the SKIDROW folder) copy the UbisoftGameLauncher.exe and paste it in C:\Program Files (x86)\Ubisoft\Ubisoft Game Launcher\.
9) Launch the game using From_Dust.exe.

This method worked for me, and I have the game running as I type this.  I didn't have to put in a username and password anywhere.  Good luck.

P.S.  There's been a repack for people with 32-bit OS.  I don't know whether my method will still work, but it's worth noting.

4: Launch the cracked exe and let it attempt to update
5: When asked for a key, hit cancel
6: Profit
